page.title: 01General Introduction.
page.content: Our Domesday block is mainly rural with many scattered farms and hamlets. The fields are used for crops such as silage, barley and wheat. Some of the fields though are used for pastoral activities, like dairying. Most of the farm houses are scattered some distance away from the hamlets. Most of the farms are modern although some of the farms are much older. All the houses are well kept, as are the crops. There are many trees around. There are a few roads, mostly they are narrow lanes with high hedges about five feet high, which obscure the view. Near the small villlage of Maesbrook flows the river Morda, which can be fished. Our Domesday block is a good example of typical British countryside
